to Germany before Versailles Treaty 1919). But there is one little

terrotories - Russia instead was not forced. The predecessors of Putin gave

territoy of Russia today, they would start a war of aggression and nothing 
less.﻿

The War Nerd: Everything you know about Crimea is wrong(-er)

On Sunday, the Crimeans voted to join Russia in huge numbers—80% turnout, 
95% for joining Russia according to reports. That result tracked with the 
BBC exit polls, which took into account the fact that most of the 
peninsula’s ethnic Tartars—about 14% of the population—boycotted the vote. 
That means a lot of ethnic Ukrainians (and maybe even a few ethnic Tartars) 
voted with the Russian bloc, and it’s not likely they did so because 
they’re rabid Russian nationalists. More likely, it reflects the fact that 
Ukraine is a very poor country, while Russia seems to be doing pretty well, 
for a “gas station masquerading as a country.” Ukraine is sort of the 
opposite: A country without the money to buy a tank of gas. The history of 
Ukraine in the 20th century is so horrific, such a non-stop nightmare, that 
it’s impossible to blame anyone who wants out.



http://pando.com/2014/03/17/the-war-nerd-everything-you-know-about-crimea-is-wrong-er/

Ready for a History lesson?
Crimea became russian land 2 century ago when there were no country by the 
name Ukraine. Frankly speaking Ukraine is a country that Russian Empire and 
Soviet Russia build of its own territories and reclaimed territories from 
Poland and Osman Empire. As you know Kiev is a great old russian city that 
even been a capital of all russian lands before mongol invaision in 13 
century ad. So as a main city of RE and USSR it was capable to govern huge 
region. As a part of RE and USSR it was given territories to govern. Well 
Crimea was the last one in 1954, But Crimea united with Ukrainian Soviet 
Socialistic Republic as autonomous republic itself with its own 
constitution and rights. When USSR went down. Crimea had all rights to 
become independent region from Ukraine but was blocked.
When three month ago opposition in Kiev overthrew Ukraine president, Crimea 
people that simply don't want to have any connections with "new government" 
remembered their own rights and voted for independence.
There was no Russian invasion. Russian military bases been in Crimea for 
centures. And they could help Crimea government to maintain order (it's in 
the agreements)
there was no annexation, Russia agreed to reunite with independent region, 
not a part of Ukraine.
The only thing you can speak against, is that regions can't get their

independence even without referendum. Kosovo was backed by USA, EU, and 
many other countries that now are in denial)﻿

+Jacques Shellac Yes, I do know about the cities too. I am from Chicago, 
Southside! Agreed, we have many poor people. (Big corp) As in Big corp fat

+Nikisright The really dirt poor can be found throughout the US. Many parts 
of our old industrial metropolises look like the worst parts of Eastern 
Europe. Some people in Detroit have reverted to urban farming or raccoon 
hunting to survive. According to the US Census, the very poorest live on

I don't hate big corporations. I do hate neo-fascist socialists. In my 
opinion they are using the government unions and corrupt banking practices 
to bring back feudalism. You can see what they're up to among the very 
richest people in our urban centers - people who are not involved in 
commerce but are involved in the government mandated fleecing of those who 
are.

+Jacques Shellac I wasn't (or didn't mean to) say that all in the south 
were dirt poor. Only meant that the really poor are in the South. People in 
WV, New Orleans, Memphis, Mississippi, etc. I once had a summer home in 
Friendship Ohio, near the Ky, WV border and had been to some of the homes 
near there without electricity or running water. The worst were the ones 
living in old school buses and used car batteries hooked up to their buses 
for some kind of electric. Weird how inventive people can be when forced 
to. In WV near the mountain top removal areas? God, how we as Americans can 
let our own people live like this is just disgusting. As for arguing with 
people here on you tube, I can't help it, it's my nature. :))))))))))

+111q222p333m444z I am now living in Romania, one of the Eastern countries 
that joined the West. The economy here is HORRID. The "West" mandated how 
many factories could stay open, and how many to close. It caused people to 
abandon their own children because they couldn't feed them anymore (Great 
victory, huh?). Prostitution is just a way of life here, BECAUSE of the 
Western influence! Not all countries flourished under Western rule. YOU 
obviously don't travel much, or know how things really are in Europe. I 
know it first hand. Secondly, I do not talk down to Ukrainians. I like 
Ukrainians and Russians alike. The Eastern people are really great and have 
worked so hard to have what they have. I don't hate any country or their 
people. I hate big corps, elitists and gov puppets.

+111q222p333m444z Um yes, actually. We still make great cars in the US, 
just not in Detroit. That's because the UAW doesn't have their claws in car 
factories situated in the US South. In fact, US workers in Tennessee making 
cars for VW just voted against allowing the UAW to seize control of their 
plant. Same deal with Toyota plants in Mississippi, Alabama, Kentucky, 
Texas and West Virginia.

Most Red states are net givers to the federal government. It's the Democrat 
run states that are sucking the federal government dry, to say nothing 
about what they're doing to their long suffering urban small business 
owners. That's why cities like Detroit have filed for bankruptcy, and why 
the Detroit Public School system is under federal investigation for fraud.

Sorry to have to say it, but you're the one who is full of shit. I'd 
normally be more polite with someone who is ignorant, but that's what you 
get for being a lying asshole.

+Jacques Shellac
Um, no. That is complete bullshit. Industry declined because of cheaper 
labor costs in the rising industrial powers of Asia, particularly China. 
People who work for a dollar a day are obviously a much better sources of 
cheap labor than Americans, who need far higher wages to live even at the 
bare minimum living standards. Automation in industry further reduced jobs, 
by making manufacturing less labor intensive.

In terms of the automobile industry, the Republicans are to blame for its 
decline - Japan and Europe (which have much stronger unions) gave their 
people free healthcare, allowing their car manufacturers to stay 
competitive as they didn't have to provide it, whereas American 
manufacturers had to provide insurance for their workers and that made them 
uncompetitive. Japanese cars cost several thousands of dollars less each to 
produce for this very reason.

People in the South may have more jobs in stuff like light manufacturing 
(I'd like to see some figures), but they also have abysmal pay and rely on 
government welfare more than any in other states. Most red states are net 
takers from the federal government, whereas most blue states are net 
givers, and blue states are on average wealthier. The highest percentages 
of people on stuff like medicaid and food stamps are in Southern states.

Actually it's quite the opposite nowadays. Half a century ago, you'd be 
right. The Eastern and Western coasts of the US, and especially the Great 
Lakes area around the Detroit-Chicago area, were industrial powerhouses and 
very rich. Now, after 50 years of kleptocratic Democrats and ferociously 
greedy unions, much of these regions are bankrupt and in ruins. By 
contrast, right-to-work states in the US South that have rejected socialism 
have prospered tremendously. Texas is doing particularly well.

Right now the US has a Democrat federal administration. So long as that's 
the case, Putin can be as much of a fascist bastard as he likes and get 
away with it. His Left fascist allies in the West can and will blame 
everything on the US government (or the Jews) regardless of anything that 
Putin does, so don't waste your time with these people.

+Nikisright
Well if you're American that only makes your opinion even worse. You have 
no idea what it's like in Russia or Ukraine, or what the people want for 
their future, and you have no right to lecture to them. Do you have any 
idea how fucking belittling you sound when you talk down to Ukrainians like 
that? The Southern US is still far richer than Ukraine. Americans are on 
average roughly ten times richer.

If it weren't for the Western  way of life, the Eastern European states 
that joined the EU would not have prospered as they did. They would not be 
peaceful, prosperous and democratic as they are. They would be poor like 
Ukraine, or a dictatorship like Belarus, or a war zone like Georgia was in 
2008. They are very proud of their achievements since joining the West, and 
you spit in their eyes. Then you spit on those who aspire to achieve the 
same things and be free of Russia at last.

I don't doubt NATO is only interested in encircling Russia, and frankly, 
I'd like to see NATO be dismantled. I don't want to threaten Russia anymore 
than you do. I don't like Western governments anymore than you do either. 
But I despise Russia's government *far* more, and I do like the Western way 
of life, and I respect the right of Eastern European countries to adopt it 
and prosper if they wish, and I will applaud their achievements as they 
strive for a better future.

What you or I or our governments want is totally irrelevant - all that 
matters is what the people of Ukraine want. So please, shut the fuck up and 
stop being a typical arrogant ignorant patronizing Westerner telling 
everyone else what's *really* going on and what they should do, as if 
they're too fucking dumb to make their own decisions. You know fuck all 
about Ukraine and it has fuck all to do with you so mind your own business.

+111q222p333m444z I do not have an empire, thank you very much. I am 
American. As for the West giving wealth and security? Is that a bad joke? 
You've obviously never visited the South in America. Dirt poor people. Our 
jobs have been sent over seas to mostly China and our f-d up gov 
continually gives our money away though we have none. People are losing 
their jobs left and right, along w/their homes and their security. Old 
people are being forced back into the work force so they can eat. Lol, you 
are in dreammmmm land. As for Poland they were only luckly and hard 
working. Romania and Russia have never recovered after the fall of 
communism. Ukraine would be better off w/Russia because they've been 
helping Ukraine. THE only country that's been helping Ukraine. The West 
only wants NATO closer in borders w/Russia. This is not about helping the 
Ukrainians. It's BSSSSSS.

You can hardly blame Georgia for wanting NATO protection when Russia 
invades them, kills their people, bombs their cities and takes their land! 
Now you're just pushing Ukraine into the same situation and making them 
more dependent on the West for security.

Russia has done fuck all for Ukraine; it is one of the poorest, most 
corrupt countries in Europe, whereas Poland is now twice as rich despite 
having been poorer than Ukraine in 1992 after the Soviet bloc broke up.

The West gives its people wealth, security and democracy - you give them 
poverty, autocrats and violence. Just leave the Ukrainian people alone, 
they are sick of being ruled by your empire. Let them decide their own 
future, you damn imperialist.
